sen.j: 桂岩院（けいがんいん、生年不詳 - 慶長9年（1604年）8月17日_(旧暦)、以下「四辻氏」と記す）は、安土桃山時代・江戸時代初期の女性。
sen.e: Keigannin (Year of birth unknown, died on September 10, 1604, referred to as 'the Yotsutsuji clan' hereafter) was a woman who lived from the Azuchi-Momoyama period to the early Edo period.
sen.cmt: 慶長9年（1604年）8月17日はグレゴリオ暦で西暦1604年9月10日となるようです。http://maechan.net/kanreki/以下「四辻氏」と記す：the Yotsutsuji clanが一人の女性を指すのは違和感がありますが、あえてそのままとしています。
sen.e: Keigannin (Year of birth unknown, died on September 10, 1604, referred to as 'the concubine Yotsutsuji hereafter) was a woman who lived from the Azuchi-Momoyama period to the early Edo period.
sen.cmt: 「桂岩院」を「四辻氏」と原文のように訳していくと後半意味合いの問題がありますので、「concubine Yotsutsuji」としました。
sen.e: Keigannin (Year of birth unknown, died on September 10, 1604, referred to as 'the concubine Yotsutsuji hereafter) was a woman who lived from the Azuchi-Momoyama period to the early Edo period.

sen.j: 上杉景勝の側室、上杉定勝の生母。
sen.e: She was a concubine of Kagekatsu UESUGI, and the real mother of Sadakatsu UESUGI.
She was a concubine of Kagekatsu UESUGI, and the birth mother of Sadakatsu UESUGI.

sen.j: 兄弟に四辻季継、高倉嗣良（後年藪嗣良と改名）等、姉妹に後水尾天皇寵姫四辻与津子。
sen.e: Her brothers included Suetsugu YOTSUTSUJI and Tsuguyoshi TAKAKURA (renamed to Tsuguyoshi YABU later), and one of her sisters was Yotsuko YOTSUTSUJI, who was a favorite concubine of the Emperor Gomizunoo.
Her brothers include Suetsugu YOTSUTSUJI and Tsuguyoshi TAKAKURA (renamed to Tsuguyoshi YABU later), and one of her sisters was Yotsuko YOTSUTSUJI, who was a favored concubine of Gomizunoo Emperor.
sen.cmt: 時制は過去形である必要はないと思います。現在において過去を確認している状況ですので、現在形のほうが自然だと思います。寵姫の訳を多少文語的にしました。後水尾天皇の訳を一般的な型にしました。

sen.j: 甥に山浦光則等、姪に文智女王、後水尾天皇寵姫四辻継子等がいる。
sen.e: Her nephews included Mitsunori YAMAURA, and her nieces included Bunchi-Joo (Princess Bunchi) and Tsuguko Yotsutsuji, who was a favorite concubine of the Emperor Gomizunoo.
Her nephews include Mitsunori YAMAURA, and her nieces include Bunchi-Joo Princess and Tsuguko YOTSUTSUJI, who was a favored concubine of Gomizunoo Emperor.
sen.cmt: 前項目と同様、時制は過去形である必要はないと思います。現在において過去を確認している状況ですので、現在形のほうが自然だと思います。文智女王はルールに従い書き換えました。後水尾天皇の訳を一般的な型にしました。
sen.e: Her nephews include Mitsunori YAMAURA, and her nieces include Bunchi-Joo Princess and Tsuguko YOTSUTSUJI, who was a favored concubine of Gomizunoo Emperor.

sen.j: 一説では上杉家に出入りする商人の斡旋により、京都で景勝に見初められて側室になったといわれているが、詳細な史料は存在せず、側室となった経緯は不明である。
sen.e: One theory has it that she was introduced to Kagekatsu by a merchant who visited the Uesugi family and became his concubine in Kyoto, but no historical materials that show the details exist, and how she became a concubine is unknown.

One theory has it that she was introduced to Kagekatsu by a merchant who visited the Uesugi family, and became his concubine in Kyoto, although there is no historical material revealing details, thus how she became a concubine is yet unknown.

sen.j: 側室として米沢に入って米沢城に居住して景勝に仕え、景勝の枕席に侍りその情を受け、景勝の子供を妊娠する。
sen.e: She entered Yonezawa, served Kagekatsu at Yonezawa-jo Castle, spent nights with Kagekatsu who favored her and conceived his child.
She came to Yonezawa as a concubine, while she resided in Yonezawa-jo Castle and served Kagekatsu at his bedding to spend nights and receive his affection, and eventually conceived his child.
sen.cmt: 「側室として」や「居住して」が訳文で欠落していましたので加えました。
sen.e: She came to Yonezawa as a concubine, while she resided in Yonezawa-jo Castle and served Kagekatsu at his bedding to spend nights and receive his affection, and eventually conceived his child.

sen.j: 景勝の伏見滞在中の慶長9年（1604年）5月に米沢城で庶子玉丸（定勝）を産んだ。
sen.e: She gave birth to Tamamaru (Sadakatsu), who was an illegitimate child, at Yonezawa-jo Castle during Kagekatsu's stay in Fushimi in May, 1609.
sen.cmt: 慶長9年（1604年）5月は西暦1604年5月29日となるようです。http://maechan.net/kanreki/
sen.e: In May 1609, she gave birth to an illegitimate child Tamamaru (Sadakatsu) at Yonezawa-jo Castle during Kagekatsu's stay in Fushimi.
sen.cmt: 語順を変え単純化しました。(青地は語順変更のみの例）
sen.e: In May 1609, she gave birth to an illegitimate child Tamamaru (Sadakatsu) at Yonezawa-jo Castle during Kagekatsu's stay in Fushimi.

sen.j: しかし、産後の経過が悪く景勝の命により快癒祈願や医師の治療など万策を尽くしたが効無く、玉丸出産から3ヵ月余り後、景勝の帰還を待たずして急死。
sen.e: But after delivering the child her health deteriorated, and despite Kagekatsu's order to pray for her recovery and treatment by doctors, she died around three months after the birth of Tamamaru, before Kagekatsu returned.

However, her health deteriorated after delivering the child, and she died three months after the birth of Tamamaru without seeing the return of Kagekatsu, despite all the efforts for her recovery by prayer or treatments of doctor upon Kagekatsu's order.
sen.cmt: Butによる文の始まりを修正しました。語順を変え重要度順に文章を直しました。
sen.e: However, her health deteriorated after delivering the child, and she died three months after the birth of Tamamaru without seeing the return of Kagekatsu, despite all the efforts for her recovery by prayer or treatments of doctor upon Kagekatsu's order.

sen.j: 景勝はこの薄幸の愛妾が余りにも早く死んだことを嘆き、その葬儀を家老直江兼続管轄の下、上杉家菩提寺の林泉寺 (米沢市)で執り行った。
sen.e: Lamenting his star-crossed favorite concubine who died too young, Kagekatsu had her funeral conducted by Kanetsugu NAOE, who was a karo (chief retainer), at Rinsen-ji Temple, which was a family temple of the Uesugi family (Yonezawa City).

Lamenting his ill-fated, much-loved concubine who died too early, Kagekatsu had her funeral conducted by a karo (chief retainer) Kanetsugu NAOE at Rinsen-ji Temple, which was the family temple of the Uesugi family (Yonezawa City).
sen.cmt: 愛妾と薄幸の説明が続くことで何が修飾され、何が修飾しているのかがわかりにくくなっています。「star-crossed」もあまり見かけないように思います。ハイフンによる強調語は繰り返される場合が多いので、愛妾を「much-loved」concubineとしました。菩提寺については特定の寺ということで定冠詞に変更しました。
sen.e: Lamenting his ill-fated, much-loved concubine who died too early, Kagekatsu had her funeral conducted by a karo (chief retainer) Kanetsugu NAOE at Rinsen-ji Temple, which was the family temple of the Uesugi family (Yonezawa City).

sen.j: 戒名は桂岩院殿月正清佳大姉。
sen.e: Her kaimyo (posthumous Buddhist name) is 桂岩院殿月正清佳大姉.
sen.cmt: 桂岩院殿月正清佳大姉：全体としての読みが不明です。Keigannin-dono Gessho Seika Daishi (a lay Buddhist)?
sen.e: Her kaimyo (posthumous Buddhist name) is Keiganinin-den Gessho Seika Daishi.
sen.cmt: 「けいがんいんでんげっしょうせいかだいし」であろうと思います。
sen.e: Her kaimyo (posthumous Buddhist name) is Keiganinin-den Gessho Seika Daishi.

sen.j: 墓所は始め米沢林泉寺、のちに寛永6年4月（1629年）景勝の菩提寺でもある米沢極楽寺に移葬。
sen.e: The tomb was initially located at Rinsen-ji Temple, and relocated to Gokuraku-ji Temple in Yonezawa, which was the Kagekatsu's family temple, in May 1629.
sen.cmt: 寛永6年4月は西暦1629年5月23日となるようです。http://maechan.net/kanreki/
sen.e: The tomb was initially located at Rinsen-ji Temple, but in May 1629, it was relocated to Gokuraku-ji Temple in Yonezawa, which was the family temple of Kagekatsu.
sen.cmt: 移動した日時は重要度が高いため、文末ではないところに移動しました。「景勝の菩提寺」の訳について、先述の「上杉家菩提寺」の語順に合わせました。
sen.e: The tomb was initially located at Rinsen-ji Temple, but in May 1629, it was relocated to Gokuraku-ji Temple in Yonezawa, which was the family temple of Kagekatsu.

sen.j: 以後米沢極楽寺は、上杉家藩主の側室の墓所に定められたという。
sen.e: It is said that Gokuraku-ji Temple in Yonezawa was designated the graveyard for concubines of the lords of the Uesugi family thereafter.
It is said that Gokuraku-ji Temple in Yonezawa was designated as the graveyard for concubines of the lords of the Uesugi family thereafter.
sen.cmt: 前置詞を追加しました。

tit.j: 複雑な背景を持つ「影の女」
tit.e: A 'shadow lady' with a complex background
A 'shadow lady' with a complex background
A 'shadow lady' with a complex background

sen.j: 四辻氏自身、そして景勝が彼女を寵愛したことは上杉藩士からは好意や好感を持たれていなかったともいわれる。
sen.e: It is said that feudal retainers of the Uesugi clan didn't have a favorable impression of the Yotsutsuji clan or the fact that Kagekatsu much favored her.
It is said that feudal retainers of the Uesugi clan did not have a favorable impression toward the concubine Yotsutsuji and the fact that Kagekatsu much favored her.
sen.cmt: 訳者は「四辻氏そのものの存在が上杉家中では疎まれていた」というように訳していますが、ここでの四辻氏は先述のように「桂岩院」一人を指しているものと思われ、四辻氏全体ではないと思います。そのように修正しました。文章では「didn't」などの省略形は通常避けられます。「did not」としました。
sen.e: It is said that feudal retainers of the Uesugi clan did not have a favorable impression toward the concubine Yotsutsuji and the fact that Kagekatsu much favored her.

sen.j: 四辻氏の米沢城入り直後に地震が起きたことを、景勝が正室の菊姫 (上杉景勝正室)を差し置いて側室である女を城内に入れたことへの天罰としたり、彼女があまりにも早く死んだ原因を菊姫の怨霊の祟りとする俗説もあるという。
sen.e: A popular belief states that the earthquake that took place right after the Yotsutsuji clan entered the Yonezawa-jo Castle is a retribution for Kagekatsu having welcomed a concubine, placing her above Princess Kiku (who was Kagekatsu UESUGI's lawful wife), and that she died too young because she was cursed by the vengeful spirit of Princess Kiku.

A popular belief states that the earthquake that took place right after the concubine Yotsutsuji came to the Yonezawa-jo Castle is a retribution for Kagekatsu having welcomed a concubine into the castle disregarding the presence of Princess Kiku (who was Kagekatsu UESUGI's lawful wife), and that she died too young because she was cursed by the vengeful spirit of Princess Kiku.
sen.cmt: 訳者は「四辻氏そのものの存在が上杉家中では疎まれていた」というように訳していますが、ここでの四辻氏は先述のように「桂岩院」一人を指しているものと思われ、四辻氏全体ではないと思います。そのように修正しました。
sen.e: A popular belief states that the earthquake that took place right after the concubine Yotsutsuji came to the Yonezawa-jo Castle is a retribution for Kagekatsu having welcomed a concubine into the castle disregarding the presence of Princess Kiku (who was Kagekatsu UESUGI's lawful wife), and that she died too young because she was cursed by the vengeful spirit of Princess Kiku.

sen.j: この俗説に関しては、菊姫は政略結婚によって上杉家に嫁いだ女性にも関わらず、複数の史書に才色兼備を謳われている程、上杉家中一同の深い敬愛を集める存在であったと伝えられることから、四辻氏という女性の存在自体を認めたくない家臣などが少なからずいた可能性は否定できないとの説もある。
sen.e: Regarding the popular belief, one theory has it that there is a possibility that not a few feudal retainers would admit the existence of the Yotsutsuji clan herself, because Princess Kiku is described as a talented woman gifted with both wit and beauty in many history books, and she is said to be deeply admired by the members of the Uesugi family despite the fact that she married into the Uesugi clan for political convenience.

Regarding this popular belief, some would consider it is the reflection of the truth; Princess Kiku is known that she was truly adored by all in Uesugi clan, substantiated by the fact that she is favorably described in various references as a woman endowed with both beauty and intelligence, despite the fact she married into the Uesugi clan for political convenience; thus quite a few feudal retainers refused to admit the presence of the concubine Yotsutsuji near Kagekatsu.
sen.cmt: 非常に複雑な原文で一文に納めるのは難しく、訳文では意味を掴むのが難しいと思います。「；」にて重要な点ごとに分節しました。要点は3つあります。1. 「この俗説は実際そうであったでとの説もある」という導入。2. 「菊姫が上杉家中で慕われていた事実」3. 「桂岩院が側室として景勝に慕われることを快く思わない家臣が多かった事実」これらをはっきりと分け、関連付けるよう書き直しました。訳者は「四辻氏そのものの存在が上杉家中では疎まれていた」というように訳していますが、原文は「四辻氏という女性の存在」と記述していますし、菊姫と比較されていることからも「桂岩院」本人の問題と考えました。
sen.e: Regarding this popular belief, some would consider it is the reflection of the truth; Princess Kiku is known that she was truly adored by all in Uesugi clan, substantiated by the fact that she is favorably described in various references as a woman endowed with both beauty and intelligence, despite the fact she married into the Uesugi clan for political convenience; thus quite a few feudal retainers refused to admit the presence of the concubine Yotsutsuji near Kagekatsu.

sen.j: しかし、当時、世継ぎのいない大名家を幕府が次々と改易していた事実を考えると、四辻氏は世継ぎを得るために家臣たちの了解と勧めによって、側室として納れた女性であった可能性が高い。
sen.e: However, considering the fact that bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) enforced Kaieki (forfeit rank of Samurai and properties) on Daimyo families (feudal lord families) who didn't have an heir one after another, it is highly likely that the Yotsutsuji clan was requested by the retainers as a concubine to produce a heir and acknowledged as such.

However, considering the fact that bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) was enforcing Kaieki (forfeit rank of Samurai and properties) one after another on Daimyo families (feudal lord families) without a successor, it is highly likely that the concubine Yotsutsuji was requested to enter the Uesugi family and acknowledged by the retainers to conceive a successor.
sen.cmt: 世継は日本では男性のみですので、男性を区別するための「heir」ではなく、successorでよいと思います。ここでも四辻氏は家系ではなく桂岩院本人とし、修正しました。語順の修正と、単語の修正を行ないました。
sen.e: However, considering the fact that bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) was enforcing Kaieki (forfeit rank of Samurai and properties) one after another on Daimyo families (feudal lord families) without a successor, it is highly likely that the concubine Yotsutsuji was requested to enter the Uesugi family and acknowledged by the retainers to conceive a successor.

sen.j: 「上杉家御年譜」によれば、定勝の誕生は直ちに当時景勝が滞在中であった伏見に伝えられ、伏見在中の家臣たちは悉く参賀し慶祝したと記録されている。
sen.e: According to 'Uesugi-ke Gonenpu (Chronological list of the main events of the Uesugi family),' the birth of Sadakatsu was immediately notified to Kagekatsu who was staying in Fushimi at the time, and all the retainers in Fushimi visited the lord to offer their congratulations.
sen.cmt: 京都プロジェクト案件 用語共有では「上杉年譜」："Uesugi Nenpu" (Uesugi's chronological record)となっているようです。
sen.e: According to 'Uesugi-ke Gonenpu (Chronological list of the main events of the Uesugi family),' the birth of Sadakatsu was immediately notified to Kagekatsu who was staying in Fushimi at the time, and all the retainers in Fushimi visited the lord to offer their congratulations.

According to 'Uesugi-ke Gonenpu (Chronological list of the main events of the Uesugi family),' the birth of Sadakatsu was immediately notified to Kagekatsu who was staying in Fushimi at the time, and all the retainers in Fushimi visited the lord to offer their congratulations.

sen.j: その後、上杉家と四辻家には、四辻氏の甥であるキリシタン公卿山浦光則の処遇を巡る幕府との軋轢などのトラブルもあった一方、景勝と四辻氏の孫にあたる三代藩主上杉綱勝は、継室として又従姉妹にあたる四辻公理の娘富姫を迎えている。
sen.e: In later years, although the Uesugi and Yotsutsuji families had trouble with bakufu over the treatment of Mitsunori YAMAURA, who was a nephew of the Yotsutsuji clan and a Christian kugyo (high court noble), Tsunakatsu UESUGI, who was a grandson of Kagekatsu and the Yotsutsuji clan, and the third lord of the domain, married Princess Tomi, who was his second cousin and a daughter of Kinaya YOTSUTSUJI, as his second wife.

In later years, Uesugi and Yotsutsuji families had trouble with bakufu over the treatment of the concubine Yotsutsuji's nephew, a Christian kugyo (high court noble) Mitsunori YAMAURA, while the grandson of Kagekatsu and the concubine Yotsutsuji, Tsunakatsu UESUGI who became the third lord of the clan, got married with his second cousin and a daughter of Kinaya YOTSUTSUJI, Princess Tomi, as his second wife.
sen.cmt: 関係代名詞やコンマによる分節が多すぎます。御純変更などで整理しました。(それでも一文にするには複雑なので、多少は残っています）
sen.e: In later years, Uesugi and Yotsutsuji families had trouble with bakufu over the treatment of the concubine Yotsutsuji's nephew, a Christian kugyo (high court noble) Mitsunori YAMAURA, while the grandson of Kagekatsu and the concubine Yotsutsuji, Tsunakatsu UESUGI who became the third lord of the clan, got married with his second cousin and a daughter of Kinaya YOTSUTSUJI, Princess Tomi, as his second wife.
